body.p:
McFerran & Menefee,
Commission Merchants, Forwarders & Cotton Factors.
Louisville, July 8. 1865
Co. W T Scott
Dear Will

I drop you aline to say to you that Mr Triplet is here, he has signed the agreement between him and myself sent down here by you, he request me to aske Gov Bramlett to destroy or send to him the agreement which he sent to have filled up he refuses to sell his remaining interest in the Gun, says he is perfectly willing to defray his proportion of the exspenses of any Competent to go to Europe and dispose of it, to the interests of all concerned, he thinks it agood thing, and seems anxious that I should go. I told him frankly that my business was such that I could not leave without great sacrifice, & I did trust be paid liberally for my time & trouble, which he says; he is willing to do. so we parted
